review: I just received Amazon Fire TV for Christmas and I love it.  It was extremely easy to setup and it is easy to use.  We've been watching quite a few movies and TV shows over the past week and I couldn't be happier.  I prefer to manage content online, as I think it's easier.  When watching a TV series, I love how it automatically pulls up the next episode.  The voice search works well, but I did find that when I used it in Netflix it took me back to Amazon.  Regardless, I highly recommend it.
author: Dianna Poissant "Dianna P"

review: As a long time Prime member, I've always loved the majority of the products Amazon has to offer.I truly wanted to like the Amazon Fire TV but no matter how many times I tried using it, it just irritates me so much! The Fire TV just couldn't hold it's internet connection whatsoever, I thought, oh hey maybe it's just my internet service being terrible but when I used my PS3 & PS4 to stream, it worked perfectly fine. The Fire TV kept freezing on me every 30 seconds, it would keep buffering every time I streamed on Netflix and Flixster which got really annoying. I'd like to actually watch a movie without having any problems but it just won't run smoothly. And the interface is not so user friendly.For now I'll just be returning the product and hoping in the near future that they'll improve on it a bit more and just maybe, I'll give it a shot then.
author: Amanda L.

review: At this time the Hulu Plus app is broken for the Fire TV. Video freezes but audio continues. You have to back out of Hulu, restart & resume show to continue watching. This can happen 4-5 times during a 30min show. Hulu is a main app we use. So this absolutely ruins the Amazon Fire TV experience for my family. You can find many many reviews of lots of users having this issue with Hulu on the Fire TV. Its not a new issue. Hulu says they are aware of the issue and have people looking at it. But the issue has been unresolved for months according to reviews. I don't have an issue with the Hulu app on any other devices including 2 smart TV's, 4 different phones, Roku 2 & 3, Samsung Blu Ray player, Xbox 360, iPad, Android tablets. Amazon Fire TV is the only device I have ever used with a broken Hulu app and as of now I am regretting choosing the Fire TV. I hope I can come back and update this as an issue that has been resolved very soon. I don't want to return this Fire TV..but Hulu just might be the reason I do.
